sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च | एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ||1||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
prakṛitiṁ puruṣhaṁ chaiva kṣhetraṁ kṣhetra-jñam eva cha
etat veditum ichchhāmi jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ cha keśhava
translation: Arjuna said: O Keshava, I wish to understand prakriti (nature) and purusha (the enjoyer), the field and the knower of the field, knowledge and the object of knowledge.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते | एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ||2||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
idaṁ śharīraṁ kaunteya kṣhetram ity abhidhīyate
etad yo vetti taṁ prāhuḥ kṣhetra-jña iti tad-vidaḥ
translation: The Blessed Lord said: This body, O son of Kunti, is called the field; and one who knows it is called the knower of the field by those who understand these things.

sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत | क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ||3||
transliteration:
kṣhetra-jñaṁ chāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣhetreṣhu bhārata
kṣhetra-kṣhetra-jñayor jñānaṁ yat taj jñānaṁ mataṁ mama
translation: O Bharata, know that I am also the knower in all fields. The knowledge of the field and its knower is true knowledge, in My opinion.

sanskrit: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् | स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ||4||
transliteration:
tat kṣhetraṁ yach cha yādṛik cha yad-vikāri yataśh cha yat
sa cha yo yat-prabhāvaśh cha tat samāsena me śhṛiṇu
translation: Now hear briefly from Me what the field is, what it is like, what its modifications are, and from what it arises, and also who the knower of the field is and what his powers are.

sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् | ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ||5||
transliteration:
ṛiṣhibhir bahudhā gītaṁ chhandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛithak
brahma-sūtra-padaiśh chaiva hetumadbhir viniśhchitaiḥ
translation: The sages have sung of it in many ways, in various hymns and also in the aphorisms of the Brahma Sutras, which are full of reason and definitiveness.

sanskrit: महाभूतान्यहंकारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च | इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ||6||
transliteration:
mahā-bhūtāny ahaṅkāro buddhir avyaktam eva cha
indriyāṇi daśaikaṁ cha pañcha chendriya-gocharāḥ
translation: The great elements, ego, intellect, the unmanifest, the ten senses and the mind, and the five objects of the senses...

sanskrit: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः | एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ||7||
transliteration:
ichchhā dveṣhaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ saṅghātaśh chetanā dhṛitiḥ
etat kṣhetraṁ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛitam
translation: Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, the body, consciousness, and resolve—this is the field with its modifications, briefly described.

sanskrit: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् | आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ||8||
transliteration:
amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṁsā kṣhāntir ārjavam
āchāryopāsanaṁ śhauchaṁ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥ
translation: Humility, absence of pride, nonviolence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadiness, and self-control...

sanskrit: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहंकार एव च | जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ||9||
transliteration:
indriyārtheṣhu vairāgyam anahaṅkāra eva cha
janma-mṛityu-jarā-vyādhi-duḥkha-doṣhānudarśhanam
translation: Detachment from sense pleasures, absence of ego, and the perception of the evil of birth, death, old age, and disease...

sanskrit: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु | नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ||10||
transliteration:
asaktir anabhiṣhvaṅgaḥ putra-dāra-gṛihādiṣhu
nityaṁ cha sama-chittatvam iṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣhu
translation: Non-attachment and absence of clinging to son, wife, home, and the like; and constant even-mindedness in favorable and unfavorable circumstances...

sanskrit: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी | विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ||11||
transliteration:
mayi chānanya-yogena bhaktir avyabhichāriṇī
vivikta-deśha-sevitvam aratir jana-saṁsadi
translation: Unswerving devotion to Me through single-minded yoga, preference for solitary places, and distaste for crowds of people...

sanskrit: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् | एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ||12||
transliteration:
adhyātma-jñāna-nityatvaṁ tattva-jñānārtha-darśhanam
etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṁ yad ato ’nyathā
translation: Steadfastness in knowledge of the self and understanding the goal of true wisdom—this is declared to be knowledge; what is contrary to this is ignorance.

sanskrit: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते | अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ||13||
transliteration:
jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣhyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛitam aśhnute
anādi mat-paraṁ brahma na sat tan nāsad uchyate
translation: I shall now describe that which is to be known, knowing which one attains immortality. It is beginningless, and it is said to be beyond both being and non-being.

sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् | सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ||14||
transliteration:
sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato ’kṣi-śhiro-mukham
sarvataḥ śhruti-malloke sarvam āvṛitya tiṣhṭhati
translation: With hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere, and ears everywhere, it pervades everything in the universe.

sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् | असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ||15||
transliteration:
sarvendriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarvendriya-vivarjitam
asaktaṁ sarva-bhṛich chaiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛi cha
translation: It shines through the functions of all the senses, yet is without the senses. It is unattached, yet supports all. It is beyond the modes of nature, yet experiences them.

sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च | सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ||16||
transliteration:
bahir antaśh cha bhūtānām acharaṁ charam eva cha
sūkṣhmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūrasthaṁ chāntike cha tat
translation: It is both outside and inside all beings, moving and non-moving. Because it is subtle, it is incomprehensible. It is far away, yet very near.

sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् | भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ||17||
transliteration:
avibhaktaṁ cha bhūteṣhu vibhaktam iva cha sthitam
bhūta-bhartṛi cha taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣhṇu prabhaviṣhṇu cha
translation: Though undivided, it appears to dwell in beings as if divided. It is to be known as the sustainer of beings, their absorber, and their originator.

sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते | ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ||18||
transliteration:
jyotiṣhām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param uchyate
jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛidi sarvasya viṣhṭhitam
translation: It is the light of all lights, said to be beyond darkness. It is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the goal of knowledge. It is situated in the hearts of all.

sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः | मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ||19||
transliteration:
iti kṣhetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ choktaṁ samāsataḥ
mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate
translation: Thus the field, knowledge, and the object of knowledge have been briefly described. One who understands this becomes devoted to Me and attains My nature.

sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि | विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ||20||
transliteration:
prakṛitiṁ puruṣhaṁ chaiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api
vikārānśh cha guṇānśh chaiva viddhi prakṛiti-sambhavān
translation: Know that both material nature and the soul are beginningless. Also know that all transformations and qualities arise from material nature.

sanskrit: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतु: प्रकृतिरुच्यते | पुरुष: सुखदु:खानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ||21||
transliteration:
kārya-kāraṇa-kartr̥tve hetuḥ prakr̥tir ucyate
puruṣaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktr̥tve hetur ucyate
translation: Material nature is said to be the cause of all material causes and effects, while the living entity is said to be the cause of experiencing happiness and distress.

sanskrit: पुरुष: प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् | कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ||22||
transliteration:
puruṣaḥ prakṛti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛti-jān guṇān
kāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo ’sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu
translation: The living entity, situated in material nature, enjoys the modes born of nature. Attachment to these modes is the cause of birth in good and evil wombs.

sanskrit: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वर: | परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुष: पर: ||23||
transliteration:
upadraṣṭānumantā cha bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ
paramātmeti chāpy ukto dehe ’smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ
translation: Yet in this body there is another, a transcendental enjoyer, the Supreme Lord, the overseer and permitter, the supporter, the experiencer, and the ultimate controller—called the Supersoul.

sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणै: सह | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ||24||
transliteration:
ya evaṁ vetti puruṣaṁ prakṛtiṁ cha guṇaiḥ saha
sarvathā vartamāno ’pi na sa bhūyo ’bhijāyate
translation: One who understands the soul and material nature with its modes will not be born again, regardless of his present condition.

sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना | अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ||25||
transliteration:
dhyānenātmani paśhyanti kechid ātmānam ātmanā
anye sāṅkhyena yogena karma-yogena chāpare
translation: Some perceive the soul within through meditation, others through analytical knowledge, and still others through selfless action.

sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्त: श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते | तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ||26||
transliteration:
anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śhrutvānyebhya upāsate
te ’pi chātitaranty eva mṛityuṁ śhruti-parāyaṇāḥ
translation: Even those who do not have knowledge but hear from others and worship with faith also transcend death, being devoted to what they have heard.

sanskrit: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् | क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ||27||
transliteration:
yāvat sañjāyate kiñchit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamam
kṣhetra-kṣhetra-jña-saṁyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣhabha
translation: Whatever is born, whether moving or non-moving, know it to be the result of the union between the field and the knower of the field, O best of the Bharatas.

sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् | विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं य: पश्यति स पश्यति ||28||
transliteration:
samaṁ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu tiṣhṭhantaṁ parameśhvaram
vinaśhyatsv avinaśhyantaṁ yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati
translation: He truly sees who sees the Supreme Lord equally present in all beings, the imperishable within the perishable.

sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् | न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||29||
transliteration:
samaṁ paśhyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśhvaram
na hinasty ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim
translation: Seeing the Lord equally present everywhere, such a person does not degrade himself and thus attains the supreme destination.

sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वश: | य: पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ||30||
transliteration:
prakṛity-aiva cha karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśhaḥ
yaḥ paśhyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśhyati
translation: He truly sees who understands that all actions are performed by material nature alone and that the self is not the doer.

sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति | तदा ब्रह्म समं सर्वं सम्पश्यन्हि तिष्ठति ||31||
transliteration:
yadā bhūta-pṛithag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśhyati
tadā brahma samaṁ sarvaṁ sama-paśhyan hi tiṣhṭhati
translation: When one sees the diversity of beings as resting in the One and emanating from it, then he attains Brahman.

sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः | शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ||32||
transliteration:
anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ
śharīra-stho ’pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
translation: The Supreme Soul is imperishable, without beginning, and devoid of material qualities, O son of Kunti. Although situated within the body, It neither acts nor is tainted.

sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते | सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ||33||
transliteration:
yathā sarva-gataṁ saukṣhmyād ākāśhaṁ nopalipyate
sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate
translation: Just as the all-pervading sky, due to its subtlety, is not tainted, so too the soul, though present in the body everywhere, is not tainted.

sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः | क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ||34||
transliteration:
yathā prakāśhayaty ekaḥ kṛitsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥ
kṣhetraṁ kṣhetrī tathā kṛitsnaṁ prakāśhayati bhārata
translation: As the one sun illuminates the entire world, so does the knower of the field (soul) illuminate the entire field (body), O Bharata.

sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा | भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ||35||
transliteration:
kṣhetra-kṣhetra-jñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-chakṣhuṣhā
bhūta-prakṛiti-mokṣhaṁ cha ye vidur yānti te param
translation: Those who understand with the eyes of knowledge the distinction between the body and the knower of the body, and the process of liberation from material nature, attain the Supreme.
